# fgeo.install

__fgeo.install__ helps you to install __fgeo__. It installs the missing dependencies from CRAN and __fgeo__ packages from source code.

1. Ensure you have a recent version of R.

2. Ensure you have updated packages (see `?update.packages()`).

3. Install devtools.

``` r
install.packages("devtools")
```

4. install __fgeo.install__.

```R
devtools::install_github("fgeo.install")
```

5. Install missing dependencies and __fgeo__.

```
fgeo.install::install_fgeo()
```
